      • bootStrap

        public static boolean bootStrap(String compFolder)
                         throws Exception
        get me the path for resourceFolder, and I will kick-start the engine for your application.
        Parameters:
        compFolder - folder relative to applicationRoot
        Returns:
        true if all OK. False in case of any set-up issue.
        Throws:
        Exception - in case the root folder does not exist, or does not required resources

      • getOAuthParameters

        public static OAuthParameters getOAuthParameters()
        Returns:
        auth parameters

      • configure

        public String configure()
        configure application based on the settings. This MUST be triggered before using the app. Typically this would be triggered from start-up servlet in a web-app
        Returns:
        null if all OK. Else message that described why we could not succeed.

      • validate

        public int validate(ValidationContext ctx)
        validate attributes
        Parameters:
        ctx - to which any error found is to be added
        Returns:
        number of errors added

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        command line utility to run any service. Since this is command line, we assume that security is already taken care of. (If user could do delete *.* what am I trying to stop him/her from doing??) We pick-up logged-in user name. Note that java command line has an option to specify the login-user. One can use this to run the application as that user
        Parameters:
        args - comFolderName serviceName param1=value1 param2=value2 .....

      • getBean

        public static <T> T getBean(String className,
                            Class<T> clazz)
        get a bean from the container
        Parameters:
        className -
        clazz -
        Returns:
        instance of the class, or null if such an object could not be located
